text: The Great Central Railway (GCR) of England was created in 1897 when the Manchester, Sheffield and Lincolnshire Railway changed its name. In 1899, the GCR opened its London Extension to a new terminus at Marylebone station. On 1 January 1923, the company became part of the London and North Eastern Railway under the Railways Act 1921. Category:Pre-grouping British railway companies Category:1897 establishments in the United Kingdom
title: Great Central Railway
